website_summaries.verdict: Basic emergency tire inflator at a remarkably low price.
pros: If you're looking for a budget solution, this compact and reliable compressor will handle all kinds of inflation tasks
It will pump up most car tires – eventually

customer_reviews.title: Single-use disposable. Failed half-way through the second tire that ...
customer_reviews.text: Single-use disposable. Failed half-way through the second tire that I was trying to top off. Definitely less than 15 minutes total runtime, and now it won't pump anymore. The gear inside is plastic, and if it gets warm, it will slip on the shaft and become permanently damaged. 300 PSI is a joke, and so is the claim of quality construction. Maybe OK for soccer balls and air mattresses...
customer_reviews.author: YDG

customer_reviews.title: READ THE 1 STAR REVIEWS and unlike me FOLLOW their ...
customer_reviews.text: READ THE 1 STAR REVIEWS and unlike me FOLLOW their ADVICE!!!! I bought this months ago, placed it in my SUV for use when needed. Today I too it out and filled one tire from 19 to 44 PSI, it died (smoking no engine power) after filling second tire from 39 to 44 PSI. Don't buy it! It's a one use one time "throw away!"
customer_reviews.author: C. B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for ocasional use. Recently bought this after air pressure warning in my SUV. Local gas stations charge $1.50 for single use and i did need it for couple of times before realsing I have nail in my front tire. Looked for bunch of them online and in local walmart. Ended up buying this minly for price and reviews. things that make it worth bying. - small form factor -Pressure aguge is part of it . -reasonable lenght of power cord -easy attach nozzle for quick attachment and removal. - 25 psi to 40 psi in about 4-5 minutes. - Ideal for top up . - Cost is about 10 times worth of gas station payment for air service. -
customer_reviews.author: Juss B

customer_reviews.title: Two and a half months,  and  two uses it died.. disappointed..
customer_reviews.text: these compressors are simple machines.. I am so very disappointed in this one.. I have used this type of compressor for my tires for years.. some last as long as 10 years... this one lasted TWO uses.. that is TWO tires.. first one it was perfect.. re inflated it in a matter of 3 minutes.. the second.. tire.. a month later.. started out fine.. then like it blew a cork.. just no air.. coming out. like in free spin.. so disappointed.. there is a year warranty.. I have not contacted the manufacture.. as of yet. but have only had this for 2.5 months.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate for trucks
customer_reviews.text: This regards a 2014 F150 SuperCrew with 20 inch wheels. The pump vibrates significantly during operation. The pump required 2.5 minutes to fill a tire from 31 to 35 psi. The power cord was not long enough to reach the rear tires from the front seat 12 V plug. The rear seat also had a plug, which was sufficiently close. The air hose was not long enough to reach the valve stem at the 9 o'clock position without elevating the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Lohr

customer_reviews.title: Try it out as soom as you get it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this last December for Christmas. Not an item you just open & try out, so I never took it out of the box. Seven months later I needed it to put air in a low tire. It ran for about five minutes, started making a noise, then just quit. Waited about 15 minutes and plugged it back in. It started to run real slow making a strange noise, and then stopped. I can't return it because it was purchased to long ago, so be advised!
customer_reviews.author: jkhammer39

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much for the price, I was, and have been pleasantly surprised. My "old" air compressor finally laid down and died. It was like this one, or at least similar in size, but that's where the similarity began, and ended. This new "pump" is way faster and better. we really like it. We (my wife and I) ride bikes that require frequent "airing up". This pump make short work of doing that!
customer_reviews.author: David Nash

customer_reviews.title: WORST PRODUCT IN THE WORLD
customer_reviews.text: AVOID AT ALL COSTS. This is the WORST piece of junk in the world. You have better luck blowing air to your tires from your mouth. Spent 10 minutes with this OBNOXIOUSLY LOUD FOR NO REASON pump and it didn't pump a single psi. I've tried on several occasions to pump air into my tire and it has never worked with this product. I have to take it to an empty lot away from houses and people to pump air, because IT IS SO LOUD I don't want people complaining about it. but IT DOESN'T EVEN WORK.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this multiple times to inflate everything from bike to automobile tires. Works great. I like the built in pressure gauge so you can actually see when the proper inflation level is reached. One word of caution is that this does seem to use a lot of the automotive battery power if used for prolonged inflation. On two separate vehicles, I've had it drain the battery so much that the vehicle wouldn't start. I now know to have the vehicle engine on while using this to prevent this from happening again. Would definitely recommend this product for home or on the road use.
customer_reviews.author: The Nurse

customer_reviews.title: spend a few extra dollars
customer_reviews.text: This compress or burned up the first time used it. Tried to put 10lbs of air in my car tire since t was running low and just stopped working. The motor started making a different noise and just stopped pumping air. Not reliable!
customer_reviews.author: I like I buy

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is poor. After 10 min of pumping
customer_reviews.text: Very weak compressor, you will wait 15 minutes, if you have Chevrolet Suburban as I do, to raise the pressure in one wheel from 24 to 40 PSI. Build quality is poor. After 10 min of pumping, smoke is going from the plastic box grills. Blow my fuse 15 amps in cabin outlet 12V. Do not buy this crap, invest in quality instruments. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. I bought this in March 2018 for emergencies. I didn't need it until Yesterday. I needed to blow up my tire on my Ford escape. I opened the box and used it for less than a minute and the motor blew. What a joke. AAA products are supposed to be good. I love Amazon so I thought win win. Not even a little. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Cardinale

customer_reviews.title: Worked 3xs then died
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my work vehicle. My assigned tahoe is cursed. I get a flat tire every 2 weeks. Bought this to help get me through shift until i could get up to fleet. Worked great 3xs then stopped working. I was so angry i threw the stupid thing at a wall. I felt much better after that. Bought a second one thinking the first just malfunctioned... Nope the second one also stopped working after 3 uses. The second one was thrown into the dumpster so hard it almost bounced out.
customer_reviews.author: Blade

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: I'd previously been using a different brand of tire inflator and bought this one when the other died prematurely. I've only used it a couple of times, but I've found it to be just what I needed. It's more compact than the old one and comes with a clip-on for connecting to the tires. Although some people might be concerned about car battery usage because the instructions say not to run the car, I was delighted with that feature. Overall it's proven to be a handy and useful thing to use when I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Bruner

customer_reviews.title: The product does what it is suposed to. The ...
customer_reviews.text: The product does what it is suposed to. The downsides don't really bother if compared to it's price and propose. which is to be used in a emergency, not on regular basis or to pump more than 2 tires. TEST: I flattened my tire to aprox. 10 psi.then used the air compressor for aprox. 9'30 to get to 30psi again. Downsides: It's kinda loud, it bounces and takes more10 minutes to pump a tire.(pictures of before and after 9'30)
customer_reviews.author: AmazonSAC

customer_reviews.title: Not what you'd want to be stuck on the side of the road with.
customer_reviews.text: It works. Slowly, and Loudly. This means that the cheap plastic will destroy itself in the heat of compressing air if you try to fill a tire from low-0 psi. I used it to top off a tire that needed barely 5 psi added and it took a solid 5 minutes and was very hot to the touch afterwards. Knowing that I am a logical human with some sense left in my noggin, I could potentially use this in an emergency situation and be ok, but it will definitely be more hell than just buying the amazon recommended one at a better price-quality value.
customer_reviews.author: Young R.

customer_reviews.title: This compressor lasted me 6 YEARS of frequent use!
customer_reviews.text: I know there are many bad reviews, but I loved this product! I bought this back in September of 2013 and it just died on me in early October of 2019. It lasted me a little over 6 years! And I used it quite frequently for my car tires. I live in a busy city with lots of construction & lots of nails in the streets...so this saved me on numerous occasions. I also used it to air up some kids bicycles in the neighborhood. The 1 and only downfall is that the thing is quite noisy. This isn't something I cared much about.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Guidry

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mother who has a leaky tire as a temp solution. The thing takes forever to air up even a few pounds of pressure. The inside of the connector that attaches to the valve stem is cheaply made gets stuck on the valve grooves and it releases what tile air you’ve just managed to pump into tire. Wish I cound return but had it too long. Didn’t realize how crappy it was until I used it myself. Mom never complained because I had bought it out of niceness. Don’t wast you money on this thing. It really is awful.
customer_reviews.author: LoveMyBoys08

customer_reviews.title: Poorly engineered, probably dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This product is poorly engineered. The power connector is not capable of handling the current the device draws. After a dozen uses, the connector fell apart. When removed from the outlet, the connector was extremely hot and the plastic was warped. The connector literally fell apart. Probably a fire hazzard. Unfortunately you do not use an air pump every day, so my return window closed 10 days before the product failed. Do not waste your money on this product, it might be a fire hazzard and not just a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but what a racket!!!
customer_reviews.text: I drive a sports car and I am a fanatic about proper tire pressures. I check them every week and used a bicycle pump to fix a low reading until it broke. This is way easier. I don’t use the dial because I have a super accurate gauge, but it seems pretty close. The one drawback — the noise this tiny box makes sounds like a jackhammer. Make sure the garage door is open or you’ll be hearing it all day. It’s faster than I thought it would be, which is a plus. I like it ... with earplugs.
customer_reviews.author: BikerBill

customer_reviews.title: Not For Truck Owners
customer_reviews.text: The pump works as expected excerpt for a couple misleading items. First, the name indicates 300 psi. However, the instructions say that the pump is not for high pressure truck tires. I guess it's fine for the 30psi tires but not for the 60 to 80 psi tires. Also, the instructions limit its use to 15 minutes. I tried to inflate a flat tire and got to about 30 psi in 15 minutes. Great for most passenger cars just not so good for a truck owner.
customer_reviews.author: wiseguy

customer_reviews.title: Got me out of a flat tire
customer_reviews.text: Got to use this for the first time today after finding a flat in the morning. (ran over a large screw). This little thing did the trick, it took about 10 minutes to get the tire up to about 25 PSI which was all i needed to get down the street to the local tire shop for repair. It does have a very light and cheap feel to it but it gets the job done. I only paid $15 for it, seems to have doubled in price since then.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made and flimsy to use. It rattles like crazy as soon as it’s switched on (I thought it was going to break apart with the force of the vibration against the ground), andthe lever is awkward to use. It also didn’t fill the tires after running for several minutes. This might be fine for bicycle tires but I found it useless for my SUV tires.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: You'll need to check the pressure with a good tire gauge
customer_reviews.text: Works reasonably well. I bought this to maintain my motorcycle tires. The motorcycle (Kawasaki) has very little clearance between the brake rotors and valve stems, but the fitting supplied with this compressor fits in there. My complaints are it is slow, and the pressure gauge goes to 300 psi, so it's very difficult to read accurately in the 30-40 psi range. You'll need to check the pressure with a good tire gauge. It does not come with a Presta valve fitting, so you can't use it for high-performance bicycle tires.
customer_reviews.author: Ten-Thumbs

customer_reviews.title: It works, thats about it.
customer_reviews.text: This works. It's slow, and tedious, and the air nozzle might stick to your tire's nipple, but it will getr your tire aired up in a pinch; the way it was designed to. It's in my emergency roadside kit for exactly that reason. This is NOT your primary means to air your tire up, this is the way to air your tire up when you patch a flat on the side of the road. It works. It's cheap. If thats what you're looking for, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Sundstrom

customer_reviews.title: Small and convenient, very loud but durable... at least my unit is.
customer_reviews.text: Small and convenient, the meter works ok too. I found the wire long enough for my grand marquis. It is noisy and slow, as expected from this small inexpensive unit: it takes a minute to increase pressure from 30 to 32 in a large passenger tire. It's been 3 years and this unit still works well, but I only use it around 4~6 times a year. The gauge to my surprise is very accurate if a bit difficult to read. I see quite a few negative reviews now, so perhaps a new batch is not as durable. Prices are also a bit higher but still inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: Staple of any emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: This will forever have a place in my car. It helped me make it from Chicago to Detroit with a newly discovered screw in my tire until I could get some fix-a-flat. I didn't find it extremely loud, even in a garage. It definitely took longer than a conventional air compressor (of course), but far less long than waiting for AAA! Also, it seemed to correlate pressures readings very well with my tire pressure gauge. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this pump for emergency’s , it worked fine the first two weeks ,for I had a slow leak and had to fill my tire once a week on my 3rd use the Unit just quit working ,it would rattle but not pump any air . They sent me another pump it was dejavú worked for a very short time .A total waste of time .
customer_reviews.author: Stallion

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 18 moths
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in December 2018 for my daughter. About a month ago while inflating a tire, the thing started smoking so we threw it away. It always seems kind of cheap and made so much noise and took a long time. In contrast I've owned a VIAIR 85P Portable Air Compressor for 8 years and never had a problem. Granted the VIAIR costs 3x more but in this case you get what you pay for. I replaced my daughter's with another VIAIR 85P.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Bought 3 and 2 already died. Problem with Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these in a few years apart. The first one I bought last the longest. It is still working. The second one I bought 2 or 3 years ago, broke in a few uses (smokes, plastic melting) The third one I bought in April 2018, used it for 3 times and it has problem with the analog pressure gauge. The product has bad quality control and it is getting worse and worse. I do not recommend this product. Thank god it didn't fail on me when I was traveling to Canada.
customer_reviews.author: THL

customer_reviews.title: Saved me from not having a car
customer_reviews.text: This saved me. Long story short I had to deal with a horrible leak in my tire. This leak was so bad that I had to refill my tire every 10 miles. If I didn't have this I would have been without a car. Yes it was annoying to refill my tire all the time. But at least I head this! Love that it has a built in gauge made refilling a lot easier. I also love that you can clamp onto the tire. So you can leave it filling, as I had to fill a lot of air.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Quick Portable Air Compressor
customer_reviews.text: Was very impressed by how quickly this blew up my tires! One was 4 lbs. low and it just took a minute to have the tire inflated to the proper psi. Also, the built in gauge was reasonably accurate - only about a lb. low (as determined by a Consumer Reports recommended tire gauge). The only problem was that it is a little noisier than previous cheaper compressors I have purchased but well worth the extra price. I highly recommend this one to anyone needing a quick little portable air compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Cramer

customer_reviews.title: The mightiest little compressor ever made.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this exactly two years ago. I've had a number of emergency inflators over the years and most last for 2-3 inflations before they die. This one is still going strong after much hard use and has saved me several times (I live in a place that's hard on tires and valve stems). So I'm buying my oldest son one for Christmas. I am very impressed with this compressor and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well but dc plug broke after a couple uses
customer_reviews.text: I liked this pump, and it works faster than my other one. It is also easy to store out of the way. Having a pressure guage on it is helpful while filling a tire, but I still confirm with a separate pressure guage. The cigarette plug fell apart and does not screw back together so it was held together with tape until I could get a new plug. I planned to cut the wire and install a better plug so it doesn't come apart in the cars outlet. The new plugs wouldn't work with it. I will need to buy a different unit
customer_reviews.author: ndcColorado

customer_reviews.title: This air compressor is fantastic. It took my rear care tire from completely ...
customer_reviews.text: This air compressor is fantastic. It took my rear care tire from completely flat to 40 PSI in about 10 minutes. You have to be careful with the device after using it for 10 minutes. It gets pretty hot so I would not immediately put it back in the box for storage. Let it cool off before putting it away. I will definitely be keeping this in my trunk along with my jumper cables. This is a great item to have in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: K. R.

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this some months ago and did not want to leave a review until I got to use it. Finally had the opportunity when my car's low tire pressure light came on. It's slow but got my tire up to the PSI it needed. My tire had a slow leak, so I was able to drive my car to the repair shop. Does what I bought it for, just incase something like this would happen.
customer_reviews.author: Dom M.

customer_reviews.title: it may be a safety feature but I can get in more air then the medium level (35) (would be nice to get it up to 40)
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my car tires, not sure if the item is broken or just sux/too weak. It will not put in as much air in tire as much as I want, it may be a safety feature but I can get in more air then the medium level (35) (would be nice to get it up to 40). Also, when I pull it out (when I'm done putting in air in tire) air comes out really fast for a few seconds which brings the air level from med to low/med (33). Very annoying, I do not recommend this product, D -
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works but slowly
customer_reviews.text: It takes a long time, about five to six minutes to go from 15 lbs to 28 lbs. I bought it so I could let the air out of my 4WHD tires and drive in the dunes and be able to pump them back up to street pressure afterwards. While it does work, it takes much longer that I anticipated
customer_reviews.author: keith j mittan

customer_reviews.title: It's a good, cigarette lighter operated air compressor.
customer_reviews.text: It definitely does it’s job but little noisy when it run. Works right out of the box for sure. It took me around 10 minutes to add 25 PSI in one tire which has 15 PSI pressure. I do have a foot pump and it could take almost same time me to pump that much pressure. It will be good for women in my family if they ever needed to pump air in car tires. They will call AAA rather to get it fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: compact air compressor
customer_reviews.text: It's quite nice to be able to correctly inflate your own tires when needed. This unit, while not what I would call heavy duty, is clearly up to the task of an occasional tire inflation. I like that it runs off the car's power ("cigarette lighter" socket) and that it is small and compact.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: It works, but buy other inflator instead
customer_reviews.text: This product died on me after less than 2 years of use. It worked as advertised. I used it primarily for inflating car tires. It was loud during operation, and I had to jack up the tire to allow the device to inflate the tires.
customer_reviews.author: someone

customer_reviews.title: Saved Me More Than Once
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it is a great thing to buy and just throw in your car and when you need it, it is there to save you. That being said, it is load and vibrates all over the place when in use, but when you have a flat/underinflated tire and need to get somewhere it is worth its weight in gold. Plus it will save your lungs when you’re floating the river and don’t want to inflate your tube manually.
customer_reviews.author: Robin H

customer_reviews.title: Worked after being out in -50 degrees
customer_reviews.text: Today is Aug 8th 2019, bought this on Jan 2nd 2017. Still working great, it always stays in my trunk. Surprisingly it worked after being in -50 degree temp outside in my car trunk. Its still works fine, gage works fine and just everything else still function perfectly fine. Love this product, recommended to couple of my friends, and I highly recommend to anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: ikram

customer_reviews.title: A good product, but it can be better
customer_reviews.text: It works very well, the only thing I want to complain about is that IF this product has a place to hold the nozzle adapters, then it will be better. After I opened the bag and used one of the nozzles, I found that this air compressor has no specific place I can store those nozzles, which mean those nozzles adapters will be got lose easily. If you don't use those nozzle adapters, then there have no problems. But if you want to use those nozzle adapters, well, good luck and don't lose them.
customer_reviews.author: rbz1988

customer_reviews.title: blew motor and melted plastic. stay away.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a beast, filled my f150 tire in no time and didn't even get hot. Works great, a must have for anyone. update: 01/10/2017 it took a dump, burned up and melted the bottom. i went to fill my tire and it blew the pump. it worked great one time and died on the second use. i may have had a defective unit or this device is junk.
customer_reviews.author: WatersMK

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend was having issues with his tires leaking and the seals and we were constantly having to get his car towed. I bought this in hopes that it would save us some towing fees and boy has it come in handy! We’ve used this twice and it’s already paid for itself. It’s easy to use and store. It comes with attachments so you can fill up a basketball or bike tires. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Geniusness0419

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I had a slow leak in my tire, which turned out to be a nail. I got it repaired but decided to buy an inexpensive air compressor to keep in my trunk. I tried it out on my bicycle tires since I didn't need any air in my car tires. Yes, it was very loud and vibrated very badly. So badly that I held it in my hands so it wouldn't bounce all over the garage floor. It quickly inflated my bike tires from dead flat (from not riding bike for months) to the proper inflation.
customer_reviews.author: Moonbeam

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and it works.
customer_reviews.text: Clips on to tire stem easily. Power cord and air hose long enough to reach all four tires on a Toyota Corolla. Stores easily in the trunk. Will purchase again for my other cars. Very convenient and handy.
customer_reviews.author: Greg W.

customer_reviews.title: Scale goes from 0 to over 200 psi.
customer_reviews.text: This compressor is small, lightweight and affordable. The power cord is long enough for my small car. I do not need a digital display. I have small tires, so it inflated them fine. I do wish the scale was more suited to auto tires in the 30 to 35 psi range. The scale goes from 0 to over 200 psi, so it's difficult to distinguish, for example, between 31 and 33 psi. So I use a separate tire pressure gauge to check.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: I had my doubts
customer_reviews.text: At first I wondered if this little unit would work. It just didn't feel as solid as I expected. Well, I used it for the first time a few days ago to add air to my SUV's tires. Power hooked up with no problem; and while this little unit is noisy, it does indeed work. It takes longer than those high-pressure units at service stations, but it works!
customer_reviews.author: blueskys

customer_reviews.title: DURABLE
customer_reviews.text: Have been using for the past two years somewhat more than normal and its done the job every time. From needing a quick 2 psi to inflating just enough to get to the tire shop, its only very mildly heated up and that was in the sun after about 5 minutes. It fills about 1 psi per 30 seconds
customer_reviews.author: Mr & Mrs Leal

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for van tires or other higher PSI tires
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my car. It was fine for usual passenger car tires (35 PSI rated) and used it often for top ups. Though this compressor is rated for 300PSI, trying to inflate my Ford van tire (80 PSI rated), it started smoking and smelling bad at about 60PSI after running for only about 10 minutes. Despite what the label says, its not a 300 PSI compressor, and not suitable for tires > rated much more than 35PSI and will destroy itself if you try.. For smaller passenger cars though with lower PSI tires, its fine.
customer_reviews.author: L S

customer_reviews.title: It never worked
customer_reviews.text: I am Writing this because I cannot Return this air pump. I bought it a couple months ago and used it for the first time today. It’s broken and doesn’t air up tires. It’s been package and never used until now. I am Completely disappointed and unhappy. I wish I woukd Have known it didn’t work when I received It so I coukd Have exchanged it for a good one. $20 lost.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan S

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but works... Hopefully it really works when needed.
customer_reviews.text: Used it a few times for just testing out, don't really need it now. Just packing it for emergency. Pump is loud, and gauge is not very accurate... but works. -1 for the following reason - Pump move around when on, brutal vibration, won't stay still. Cable is very hard to manage, only a tiny hole to hold the cables
customer_reviews.author: A. Lin

customer_reviews.title: No stars if possible.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for emergency use in my car. When I needed it, it didn't work. Of course it's past the time I could return it - so it's a frustrating waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. L.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I used it once and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I used it once and it worked perfectly. It's loud and slow, but I have had these small low-power air compressors before, so I knew what to expect. I'm guessing it can't be that small and light and be very powerful, so I think it's a good value. My tire was low (under 20 psi) and filled it up to 35 psi. I didn't time it, but seemed to only take 3-4 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Thibodeaux

customer_reviews.title: Very loud and broke after pumping up a few bicycle tires...
customer_reviews.text: This little compressor works well when it works. Very loud, but effective. Unfortunately, it broke after only a few uses (inflating bicycle tires). Smoke from the gills with the typical dead electronics smell...Definitely not a unit to trust in an emergency. Shame on the AAA for endorsing this sad product. My recommendation: Pass on this one, and get something different.
customer_reviews.author: Cleaver Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for under $20
customer_reviews.text: If your simply going to buy an air inflator, a 12V one like this is great. It does a fine job and you can't beat a portable device you can take anywhere. It only took 4-5 Min to pump up a car tire from 25 to 44 lbs. Nice looking product with room to store the cords & put back in box for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Snodgress

customer_reviews.title: Overall I’m very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Works well but makes a lot of noise and takes more time than a big compressor. It does caution one not to overuse it or it could overheat which is my greatest fear when using it to get all four tires even. I’ve had it for several years and overall I’m very pleased and keep it in the trunk of my car for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Peantell

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad! However
customer_reviews.text: This can air up my 31" jeep tires from 15 psi to 30 psi in about 5 minutes. Not too bad! However, my 33" tires on my truck where taking a lot longer, closer to 10 minutes, to get aired up. So if you have smaller tires, this will work just great. If you have bigger tires you may want a bigger compresses
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: 2 years now and still running
customer_reviews.text: I will have this in my car trunk all the time. very easy to use. just connect to the tire nozzle and press the start button. this could inflate 5 PSI in about 1 minute. The only draw back is that, we need to stop this once desired PSI is reached.
customer_reviews.author: Das

customer_reviews.title: Good backup air pump to keep in your car.
customer_reviews.text: This pump works great in a pinch. You can top up car tires or bicycle tires. The power cord is long enough to reach all 4 of my car tires from the cigarette outlet. Plus there is a pressure gauge right on the pump so you know when to stop filling. The disadvantages: It's very slow on filling car tires. It's very loud. Seriously it's like a jackhammer. I can't use this at night because it will wake the neighbors up.
customer_reviews.author: patrickane

customer_reviews.title: Works like it says it will.
customer_reviews.text: I am verry impressed with it,I tried it a few days on my car tire that has a tendancy to slowley loos pressure over a month or so, it was down to 24 psi and should be at 31 psi normally to 34 psi winter time because of varring temp. it took about four to five min. to bring it to 34 psi' it is loud but who cares you can do work around the yeard while waiting for it to do it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Harold L. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Got stuck in cigarette lighter, broke while trying to ...
customer_reviews.text: Got stuck in cigarette lighter, broke while trying to pull it out and shorted the fuse. 2nd time it happened, went with a higher quality pump after that.
customer_reviews.author: Randy R.

customer_reviews.title: Depending on your use...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful compressor to just add 1-3 psi when needed in the tires. I like to make sure my tires are within 1 psi of the recommended tire pressure so I check my tires once\twice a month. Usually 1 or 2 tires need a psi or 2 and this device is great to use instead of having to get the large air compressor. Adds about 1 psi every 15-25 seconds, so its not super quick. If you are using it to just maintain tire pressure and you don't have any leaks in your tire, you can't find anything better for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: It's really bad, I got this for emergency, just tried it once, to make sure it's working, then I kept it in my car, then I needed it really bad for my tires as I used my 3 times towing, with no result, nothing at all.. no air is coming out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Akram Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, time saver
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in my car at all times. I use it to top my tires off when needed. I find I used it more often than I thought. The little psi gauge is semi-accurate. I still use a pen psi gauge to get an accurate reading. It is loud as hell though, but that's normal. My only problem with it -1 star, is the little compartment to store the power cable and hose. It is difficult to get them back in the compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Very noisy and pumps slowly
customer_reviews.text: Had this since November 2017. It did the job albeit very slowly and noisily but two days ago it started to spark in the motor and stuttered. After it got to about 35 psi I started taking a smell so I turned it off.... Seems as if it is dying. Now looking for another less noisy that pumps quicker.
customer_reviews.author: Mervin James

customer_reviews.title: Great $ great quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I like the tire valve quick connect/release. There is no function to set pressure and have it shut off automatically. You have to watch it and turn it off once pressure is reached. Great to have in your trunk
customer_reviews.author: Tech Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Works, worth having, low profile.
customer_reviews.text: This fits underneath my driver or passenger seat, that is pretty cool. The only downside is that it is loud, but do you really care about that if you need it? It works, inflates things, has a long cord. Worth having for just in case!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Convis

customer_reviews.title: It works exactly as you would expect for something of ...
customer_reviews.text: It works exactly as you would expect for something of its size and power supply. I got two flat tires at one time, so I change one out with my spare and inflated the other from totally flat in a few minutes to get me by until I could get them patched the next day. I use it to keep my tire pressure topped off as well. It's loud. It's slow. But it's compact and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: These are very handy to have in the trunk. I’ve used it a couple times without any issues. I did notice it seems to have more power with car running not just the key in the on position. Small enough to store without hassle and they provide a few different tips for inflating different items. It is noisy, but that’s to he expected
customer_reviews.author: amzonian

customer_reviews.title: Air gauge no good  = Unit no good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few months back, but used it for the first time today - The air gauge won't report any PSI when I attach it to the tire valve - The air gauge shoots up to 60 psi when I turn it on (I normally fill to 30psi) - The air gauge didn't appear to show the tire filling with any air after 2 minutes of operation While the unit is worthless, it did come with a nice velcro cable tie that works well. So 1 star for the unit, 1 star for the cable tie.
customer_reviews.author: Randall P. Mcdonnell

customer_reviews.title: Inferior Compressor Performance and Poor Quality Item
customer_reviews.text: I would return this compressor (Lifeline AAA 300 PSI 12 Volt DC Air Compressor) for a refund if time to return this product had not run out. I only needed to use it twice. The first time it worked very slowly as it finally filled the tire I was airing back up. The second time I used it it quit compressing air altogther and it began to rattle. Very disappointed with this product. I also bought one for my daughter to use, but will have to warn her about its inferior performance and poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Reid

customer_reviews.title: Only good for emergency use. Don't expect any sort of long-term use.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely made very cheaply. The first time I used it, it took a few minutes to even go from 35-42 psi on one of my tires. It was at night, and looking at the unit as it was operating, you can see sparks from inside the unit. This is not something that I feel I can rely on for more than emergency tire inflation, and even then I don't suspect it will last more than 30 minutes total cumulative lifetime use. Will return and look for alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Fix a leak
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in case I ever had a slow leak and needed to get to a tire repair station. I have had some air leaking from my tire because of temperature changes. So I used the air compressor to fix the tire and it worked beautifully, I would recommend to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Mattie Gibson

customer_reviews.title: can't recommend for SUV.
customer_reviews.text: Can't say I am happy with this pump. It takes eternity to blow required 2.4 May be I should have bought something more expensive with sort of guaranteed power but there was a lot of positive feedback on this one. Not sure. Just wanted to say this is not something I would buy second time. Damn, I would be glad to return even the one I already posses.
customer_reviews.author: Observer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like having to spend a dollar fifty every time I needed a little air in my tires, so I bought this little gem. Although it is a little loud and takes a little while if your tire is really low, it's a great thing to have in your trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Bluelady

customer_reviews.title: All air but no gauge
customer_reviews.text: The product works fine ... as advertised. However, the gauge didn't work at all when filling the tires of a two-wheel hand truck. Without the gauge, you'll either need to have one or do without. Not a good idea, is it?
customer_reviews.author: Keys220

customer_reviews.title: It works great.  Slow but steady.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works. Had a flat with my 2007 lincoln towncar. I had not moved it in a month or something. It was flat to the ground it pumped it up. It's a little slow and somewhat loud (can't imagine any of these brands ever being quiet or they're very expensive), but it works great. This is also one use after having it for a month.
customer_reviews.author: Pat G.

customer_reviews.title: This product is terrible
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the gauge doesn't work. Then, trying to fill a blow up mattress could not have been slower and then it started to overheat. I bought it thinking it would blow things up quickly. My dog Boo could blow up a mattress faster. I would return it but I don't see how I can.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Smith

customer_reviews.title: dont be in a hurry
customer_reviews.text: Product is good for the price. it has a higher max psi than alot of other pumps. do not be in a hurry though, i had a flat tire and it took approximately 15-20 minutes to fully inflate ir back to 37psi. after about 10 minutes you have to shut it off ans allow the unit to cool or it will start smoking.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: okay product but fills tires slowly...
customer_reviews.text: okay product but fills tires slowly...i filled one tire at the car wash and had dried the whole car before topping off one tire Update...used it twice and now the max pressure is 20lbs. if the tire has a little more you can watch the gague drop while it is running all the way down to 20. complete junk... i do need one that works if anyone has tried something else that works???
customer_reviews.author: M Hennessy

customer_reviews.title: It takes several minutes (10+ minutes) to pump up our ...
customer_reviews.text: It takes several minutes (10+ minutes) to pump up our car tire from around 20 PSI to 32 PSI. I bought 2 of these pumps, one for each of our 2 vehicles -- and both perform the same. Edit: As of today (10/7/2015) the pump went out. The back of the unit says to let it cool if it runs for longer than 15 minutes. The description says it takes 8 minutes to go from 0 to 35 PSI. That is a false statement. In my experience, to go from ~20 to ~32 PSI takes more along the lines of ~15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M

customer_reviews.title: Good but with one major flaw
customer_reviews.text: I really like that this compressor will lie flat on the ground. My old one sat on its side so it would vibrate and fall over. The biggest drawback is that the connecting cord is too short to reach the top of larger car tires. With performance tires on a Charger, if the valve happens to be at the top of the tire then you must hold the compressor in the air to attach and fill it. It is also noisy, but I expect that from all small compressors. For the price, I think this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: N. H.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this inflator!  Its struggle to pump air over 40 PSI.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this inflator! Its a struggle to pump air over 40 PSI. My Porsche 911 Turbo S rear tire requires 44 PSI. This pump barely went up to 40 PSI in my first use and second use this morning. It claims it can go up to 300PSI !/? A true advertising fraud. I regret to buy it. Amazon should stop this vendor to sell product like this, its hurting all the consumers & Amazon patrons. Please discontinue your business with this lousy vendor. Guys don't buy it! Allen
customer_reviews.author: ALLEN LIN

customer_reviews.title: I can't hear you....this thing it too loud!!
customer_reviews.text: I guess this works as advertised. I bought this because it says it works well with truck tires. Technically yes, but it takes super long to inflate. I gave it three stars for one main reason. It's SUPER LOUD. I have a small compressor for my car and it is much quieter. It's not a bad product, but too loud and too slow to inflate for truck tires anyway.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: While it lasted...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a while. Then in a crate-storage in back of pickup, it came apart for no reason. Must have been the bumps and sharp turns while driving. Disappointed on the durability. The on/off switch snapped inside case followed by the gauge sinking inside. Eventually the pump would turn on when it wanted, after several on/off tries. I had trash this one out of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Padilla

customer_reviews.title: LifeLine AAA 12VDC Air compressor / tire pump
customer_reviews.text: It took me about 4 minutes to air one tire from 25 PSI to 32 PSI. After that, the compressor got pretty warm. I hope I won't encounter a situation where I need to air more than one tire. Like many reviewers said, it pumps slow and it's very loud. It's true. But at such a low price, I feel all these cons are acceptable. After all, this little pump still does its job. I only hope it will serve for at least a couple years. If it does break in the near future, I will come back to my review and lower its star.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: This compressor beats using a manual pump every time.
customer_reviews.text: When you need air and your car battery has a charge, this is the reliable tool to use. It's kind of noisy, but it beats using a manual pump, or one of those rechargeable portable booster/charger/compressor units that loses its ability to hold a charge just sitting in your trunk. An excellent product. Every car should have one.
customer_reviews.author: Luigi Vampa

customer_reviews.title: The AAA on the package turns out to be a worthwhile endorsement.
customer_reviews.text: It has a, relatively, accurate PSI Gauge, reasonable pump rate and noise level. It worked so well, I bought a second one. The power cord plugs into the cigar lighter/accessory plug, and is long enough to reach all four tires on a large sedan. There have been no issues since I purchased the first one approximately one year ago. It vibrates like they all do, but not excessively (and it does not walk all over the place).
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one for every vehicle we own! It is a great item for piece of mind. We have already had to use them a couple of times. Easy to use, works great. Love the small compact size. We keep them in the boxes so they are easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Guertin

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE--plug got stuck in power outlet
customer_reviews.text: My first bad review on Amazon. The plug end got stuck in my car's power outlet and eventually came out in multiple pieces....had to get in there with needle nose pliers to get the end out!! i haven't been able to test the outlet yet, but i sure hope it's not damaged because of this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Brett A. Strong

customer_reviews.title: Good for that emergency away from home.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, compact emergency 12 VDC air compressor. Bought this to use in an emergency when more than 50-miles from tire service retailers. Have BMW with run-flat tires and this along with tubeless tire kit should help me extend the range back to civilization where a proper repair can be effected. Note that also purchased tire valve extender as the chuck on this will not work with TPMS valve stems. It's small enough to fit into one of the nooks in the trunk where a spare tire should live. Cheap insurance for what could otherwise be a long, expensive tow home.
customer_reviews.author: kdu-917

customer_reviews.title: Great small aircompressor with great price
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this little thing recently and it had a chance to save my day already. The price is great. The size is small and right. It works very good for this type of air compressors. Definitely it worth 5 stars review. 100% satisfaction is received by me. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Anatolii Gl

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: The dial that shows how much pressure you're at as you pump in air is very small and not divided in small enough increments. If you want 32 psi, for example, you only see 30 and 40 and a notch in between for 35. I had to also use my tire gauge to get it to exactly 32. Other than that it's easy to use and very handy to have in your trunk should you need it. It is very loud, but so what. You of course have to turn on your engine to use your lighter for power, btw.
customer_reviews.author: Puzzle Kat

customer_reviews.title: Compact and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Very compact and inflated surprisingly fast given its size (for my Honda 2014 CRV tires I’d say about 2 PSIs/min). The meter does shake a lot during use though, so I use an electronic pressure gauge to check.
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my pump in May and used it once to pump my daughter's tire up. It worked very slowly, but it worked. Put it away until I needed it again in December and it no longer works. The Value price is not a value if it only works once! Sadly disappointed that it's too late to return this faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: sherry catron

customer_reviews.title: Works good 👍
customer_reviews.text: Very inexpensive for what you get. No frills... like a light or anything like that, BUT it works. It has a long cord, one button and one gage. Easy to use. For the price you can't beat it. 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: This little pump is so loud the tow truck will hear you fifteen miles away. It should ship with hearing protection. This little air compressor works just fine and is a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Schroeder

product_meta.title: Lifeline AAA 300 PSI 12 Volt DC Air Compressor
product_meta.description: Style:Standard Tire InflatorThis full featured, top of the line, AAA branded air Compressor comes fully loaded with features and is the Idea accessory for your car. With the AAA brand, One of the most trusted in the automotive industry, you know you are getting a reliable, useful product that will be there for you when you need it most. To use you simply plug the extension lead into cigarette lighter socket, and you are ready to go. This high quality, DC 12 300 PSI air compressor is ideal for inflating tires that have lost air. The compressor's high quality allows for it to inflate a standard size tire (P195/65 R15) from 0 - 35 PSI in 8 minutes. The compressor's power cord connects easily to your automobiles cigarette outlet, and includes 3 nozzle adapters for different size inputs, and features a built in pressure Gauge on the exterior of the compressor to ensure that you inflate the tire to the correct pressure requirement for your tire. A portable tire pump such as this 300 PSI AAA air Compressor is the essential safety item to have in your car, or to add to your car safety kit. Not only does having your tire properly inflated help fuel economy, It is essential for safe driving. Additionally, the included adapters allow for you to inflate sports equipment such as a basketball, volleyball, football, bike or ATV tires, as well as other inflatables like a camping mattress. This AAA air Compressor features: built in pressure Gauge, storage for power cord and adapters, car power adapter, quick connect air hose and 3 nozzle adapters. The tire Air Compressor can inflate a standard car tire in 8 minutes (from 0 - 35Psi standard tire size P195/65 R15 - larger tires will Require longer time to inflate). this AAA portable air compressor is the ideal accessory for your car, truck or SUV and the compact size of this tire pump makes it easy to store inside the many compartments your car provides. The DC power adapter plugs into the cigarette lighter in your auto, and the cord is long enough that it can easily stretch to reach any of your four tires, and features an easy to read analog pressure gauge with PSI/kPa readout.
feature_bullets: AAA Quality: Inflate a standard spare car tire in 8 minutes with this AAA 300 PSI portable tire inflator. Featuring a heavy duty and powerful motor, this compressor is one of the essential automotive accessories for a car, pickup truck, van and SUV. Can also be used for an ATV or motorcycle tire when using a converter.
Compact: The 10 ft DC power cable and 1.5 ft quick connect air hose are easily stored inside of the compressor. The compressor's measurements are 8" x 6" x 4".

Versatility: Using the included nozzle adapters, this air compressor can be used for a bike tire, basketball, volleyball, football, inflatable pool toy's and other inflatables such as an air bed or mattress.
Peace of Mind: This air compressor is essential to keep in your vehicle in case of an emergency or disaster when on the road along with various other tools and gadgets.

Convenience: Simply plug the DC power cable into your cigarette lighter socket, attach the quick connect air hose to your tire and turn the compressor on. Watch the built in easy to read pressure gauge as you inflate the tire to the desired PSI.

specifications.Model: AAA 300 PSI 12 Volt DC Air Compressor - Tire Inflator with Built in Pressure Gauge
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,816 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
